plugins.name: Batch Icon Logo Resizer
plugins.description:
Select all the icons or logos, run the plugin, automatically resize, and organize in a grid.

Say goodbye to the cumbersome task of manually resizing large icons and logos.


  • Visually proportional resize icons or logos
  • Organize in the same size containers in a grid.


Scale factor

If the scale factor is 0, all logos are the same width. If the scale factor is 1, all logos are the same height.


Credits

This plugin is powered by Create Figma Plugin and inspired by Dan Paquette.

accepted.name: Chien-Ju Peng
accepted.description: Web Designer & Front-end Developer

plugins.tagline: Visually proportional resizing icons or logos

plugins.name: Mediamask Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Create Automated Image Generation with Custom Templates for Social Media and More


Mediamask.io is a service to generate images automatically via APIs and Integrations from custom Figma Templates. Install the plugin to turn your figma designs in dynamic templates.


Features:

  • automatically generate og images for thousands of pages based off your figma designs
  • specify dynamic image and text layers
  • fill the dynamic layers with text and image information from your pages

plugins.name: theme color token
plugins.description:
⭐️️ Help you generate sys tokens for all themes, based on the token links from a full theme.

  • ref color example: [themeName]/ref/blue-50
  • sys color example: [themeName]/sys/primary


👋🏻️ Steps to use this plugin:

  1. Create a full theme (ref & sys) in color style, make sure the folder dir matching the structure above.
  2. Create other theme's ref color palette.
  3. Choose the full theme as the basic theme, the plugin will automatically get token links.
  4. Click 'generate' to generate sys tokens based on the token links for all themes.


✨️ Tips:

  1. 'generate' will skip theme which already have sys folder, so you don't have to create empty sys folder.


📣️ New Feature:

  • Importing color styles from external palette(eg. eva color palette) via JSON file.

accepted.name: BIAsia
accepted.description:
previously working on 
https://design-toolkit.framer.website/

plugins.name: Pagination
plugins.description:
Pagination is the most efficient way to paginate your slides.


Are you using Figma prototype to create presentations? If so, you've likely faced the challenge of adding pagination, just like we did, whether manually or with unreliable plugins.


That's why we developed Pagination: our own simple solution to make pagination less frustrating.


How it works?

  1. Add a {current} text layer for each page number.
  2. Include a {total} text layer for the total page count.
  3. Select frames, if you don’t paginate everything.
  4. Let the plugin automatically rename and reorder frames, and paginate!


Tips & tricks

  1. Place {current} and {total} occurrences in separate text layers.
  2. Pagination handles hidden {current} occurrences.
  3. Insert a separator text layer of your choice between {current} and {total}.
  4. Pagination follows the natural reading order in Figma, from top-left to bottom-right.
  5. No need to update numbering if the slide order changes or duplicates occur. Simply run the plugin again, and Pagination will take care of it!


About

Pagination is built by Source.paris and inspired by Numerator.

We specialize in helping companies solve complex problems, drive business growth, and delight their customers through Design & Engineering.


If you have questions, suggestions or feedback, just leave a comment below and we’ll try to answer ASAP.


Happy paginating!

accepted.name: Anaïs Lorteau
accepted.description: Front-end developer

accepted.name: Andréa Schoepflin
accepted.description: https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrea-lucie-schoepflin/

accepted.name: Olivier Chatel
accepted.description:
UX Designer | Managing director source.paris
Bureau of Design & Technology

plugins.tagline: The most efficient way to number your slides

plugins.name: Mental Health & Cognition Plugin
plugins.description:
About this plugin


Products impact how we feel, think, and behave. This plugin aims to help all product makers design inclusively for a range of mental health & cognitive needs. It’s our responsibility to consider the impact our designs can have. Use the evidence-based guidance in this plugin to design mindfully and advocate for inclusive design choices.


With insights from published research, focus groups, expert review, and co-creation sessions, we have identified principles key to designing for mental health and cognition. Consider how you can preserve attention and motivation, direct action and energy, and customize experiences to increase belonging and agency.


Using the plugin


  1. Consider what common patterns are present in your design
  2. Explore evidence-based guidance for each pattern to identify top stressors and suggestions
  3. Empathize with customers through direct quotes
  4. Drag guidance and customer voice onto your canvas to help you modify your design and defend inclusive design decisions
  5. Work with your team to embed wellbeing in your designs, share the plugin broadly, and contribute to the inclusion revolution!


The basics of designing with mental health and cognition in mind


  1. Inclusive design demands collaboration with the people you seek to serve. Co-creation with customers who have permanent mental health and cognition needs will create value for customers who have temporary or situational needs.
  2. Usable design is inclusive design. When people can’t use technology, they tend to blame themselves, aggravating emotional and mental health needs. Prioritize usability.
  3. Reduce the cognitive demands of your design by breaking down large tasks or information into smaller chunks and helping customers to manage distractions, initiate and complete tasks, and remember steps or information.
  4. Celebrate success to preserve motivation through positive emotions and enhance flow.
  5. Use more than just engagement metrics to measure success. Embed opportunities to learn how users feel. Over-reliance on MAU and DAU can encourage design choices that deteriorate a customer’s experience.



Learn more about the plugin, the research that informed it, and accessibility best practices


Check out Microsoft’s guidebook and case studies for Cognition and for Mental Health. Leverage tenets and traps and universal design principles to further ensure great usability. To learn more about accessibility for the web visit w3.org.


This plugin is brought to you by Microsoft


Special thanks to Kelly Gorr, Ali Benter, Amanda Poh, Will Brennan, Amanda Yang, Tany Holzworth, Karina Dion, Ben Truelove, Tasha Lutfi, Christa Keizer, Hernan Maestre, Alice Lee, Bradley Stastny, Brandon Foy

accepted.name: Microsoft
accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

accepted.name: Amanda Poh
accepted.description: Product Design @ Microsoft

plugins.tagline: In context guidance for designing inclusively

plugins.name: Plot Pilot
plugins.description:
Select a Graph Type and start filling in the inputs in the table.


HOW IT WORKS:

Note: Do not delete the auto inserted frame before closing the plugin, or press cancel and it will be deleted itself.


For Bar, Scatter and Rectilinear/Curved Graphs, fill at least two rows to see Plot Pilot in action.

Input rows can be appended with the '++' button in each Graph type.


Rectilinear and Curved Graphs: Enter values for X and Y Axis. Give the axes a label (optional). The axes scales are determined automatically and the numbers can be turned off. Select the Curve checkbox to enable handles to play with Bezier curves for each of the points.


Scatter Plot: Just like Rectilinear/Curved Graphs, enter just the data required in the table and you will experience the magic of graph creation.


Bar Graph: The input table has two fields, Frequency and Bar Label. Enter the Bar heights in Frequency while the latter field is optional. Just like the other graphs, the scale is automatically determined based on inputs.


Pie Charts: Enter values in decimals for each row. For example: 0.15, 0.15, 0.2, 0.5 would create a complete Pie chart.
plugins.tagline: Beyond bars & pies. Captivate with Plot Pilot's interactive curves. Chart magic, made simple.

78886.description:

Rectilinear and Curved Graphs: Enter values for X and Y Axis. Give the axes a label (optional). The axes scales are determined automatically and the numbers can be turned off. Select the Curve checkbox to enable handles to play with Bezier curves for each of the points.


Scatter Plot: Just like Rectilinear/Curved Graphs, enter just the data required in the table and you will experience the magic of graph creation.

78886.release_notes: Added background options for Rectilinear, Curved and Scatter Plots (Grid, Dotted Grid)
78886.tagline: Beyond bars & pies. Captivate with Plot Pilot's interactive curves. Chart magic, made simple.

plugins.name: Theme Buddy for Ant Design
plugins.description:
Theme Buddy for Ant Design

Theme Buddy for Ant Design is a Figma plugin that simplifies working with Ant Design themes. It has an export feature that lets you save Figma theme settings as JSON files, making it easy for developers to ensure their code matches Figma designs. It also has an import feature that allows you to apply theme settings from your code directly into Figma.


Learn more


Requirements

  1. Must have the Ant Design System for Figma version 5.11 or newer.
  2. Compatible only with Ant Design System for Figma and AntBlocks UI, not with other UI kits.
  3. JSON output is usable in the React version of Ant Design (5.0+).


How to use it?

Read the documentation here.

accepted.name: Matt Wierzbicki
accepted.description: Product designer and entrepreneur running multiple projects.

plugins.tagline: Transfer theme settings from Figma to React by converting Figma variables into a JSON format

103850.description:

It has an export feature that lets you save Figma theme settings as JSON files, making it easy for developers to ensure their code matches Figma designs. It also has an import feature that allows you to apply theme settings from your code directly into Figma.


Learn more


Requirements

  1. Must have the Ant Design System for Figma version 5.11 or newer.
  2. Compatible only with Ant Design System for Figma and AntBlocks UI, not with other UI kits.
  3. JSON output is usable in the React version of Ant Design (5.0+).


How to use it?

Read the documentation here.
103850.release_notes:

- Decreased the plugin's size
103850.tagline: Transfer theme settings from Figma to React by converting Figma variables into a JSON format

plugins.name: Raster
plugins.description:
Raster is a photo manager and editor for modern teams. With this plugin, you can use photos from your Raster libraries directly in Figma.


A DAM from the future— Raster focuses on improving efficiency for teams that want to save time when shipping photography and digital assets. Raster organizes images with AI tags, allows real-time collaborative editing with unlimited versioning, and hosts each file and version on a world-class CDN, letting you ship your photography, faster.
plugins.tagline: Photo manager and editor for modern teams.

47194.tagline: Photo manager and editor for modern teams.

plugins.name: Bounding Box
plugins.description:
Bounding Box allows designers to easily create and customize bounding boxes around their design elements. With a variety of options, such as color, stroke weight, dash patterns, and box styles, users can effortlessly define and style bounding boxes to fit their design aesthetics.


How to Use


Select the objects that you want to put within the bounding box. Run the plugin and you can customize the following properties :

  • Color
  • Stroke Weight
  • Dashes


Three different types of bounding boxes can be created

  • A box with corner rectangles that have a stroke and fill
  • A box with corner rectangles that have only a fill color
  • A box with no corner rectangles

accepted.name: Abhishek Shankar
accepted.description: Product Designer & Tinkerer

plugins.tagline: A handy plugin to create bounding boxes with different styles from your selections

66477.tagline: A handy plugin to create bounding boxes with different styles from your selections

plugins.name: Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
Styles to Variables is a Figma plugin designed to empower design system creators. It seamlessly converts your existing local styles into Figma's robust design tokens, known as "Variables." This automation simplifies the management and organization of your Figma projects, making your design workflow more dynamic and efficient.


How to Use


  1. Run the Plugin: Start the plugin to begin the conversion process.
  2. Choose Collection: You have the option to select an existing variable collection or create a new one. If you choose an existing collection, you can also specify a mode.
  3. Specify Mode: If you're using an existing collection, you can either update an existing mode or create a new one. Simply type the mode name; the plugin will automatically detect if it should update or create.
  4. Execute: Click the "Convert" button to start the conversion. The plugin will convert local styles into variables and place them in the specified collection and mode.
  5. Review: After the conversion is complete, review the variable collection and modes to ensure they meet your requirements.


Core Features


  • Local Style Conversion: Automatically converts all local styles into Figma Variables.
  • Collection Management: Choose to add variables to an existing collection or create a new one.
  • Preservation: Maintains the original names, color values and descriptions of your local styles during conversion.


Key Benefits


  • Efficiency: Streamline your design process by automating the conversion of local styles to variables.
  • Flexibility: Choose between adding to an existing collection or creating a new one, giving you more control over your design tokens.
  • Integrity: The plugin preserves the original names and values, ensuring a smooth transition to a token-based system.
  • User-Friendly: With its intuitive UI and straightforward options, the plugin is accessible for users of all skill levels.

accepted.name: Sascha Wohlgemuth
accepted.description: UX Designer @ Hoffmann Group

plugins.tagline: Convert Local Styles to Variables in a Snap!

75346.name: Styles to Variables
75346.description:

This automation simplifies the management and organization of your Figma projects, making your design workflow more dynamic and efficient.

  4. Execute: Click the "Convert" button to start the conversion. The plugin will convert local styles into variables and place them in the specified collection and mode.
  5. Review: After the conversion is complete, review the variable collection and modes to ensure they meet your requirements.

75346.release_notes:
- Figma Variable System Integration: Enhanced usability with seamless integration into Figma's variable system
- Default Theme Support: The plugin now automatically supports your default application theme
75346.tagline: Convert Local Styles to Variables in a Snap!

plugins.name: Multi lorem ipsum: HE/AR/ENG
plugins.description: Multi lorem ipsum: HE/AR/ENG for Figma is a versatile text generation plugin that allows users to generate placeholder text in different languages (Hebrew, English, Arabic) based on the desired number of words or the text box size. The plugin can automatically measure and fill text within a text box, ensuring it fits perfectly. Users can customize their experience by saving language preferences and the number of words to generate for future sessions. With full accessibility support, the plugin also allows users to easily close it after text generation, making it simple and efficient to use.
plugins.tagline: Generate placeholder text effortlessly for design mockups. Fast, flexible, and easy to use.

114629.name: Multi lorem ipsum: HE/AR/ENG
114629.description: Multi lorem ipsum: HE/AR/ENG for Figma is a versatile text generation plugin that allows users to generate placeholder text in different languages (Hebrew, English, Arabic) based on the desired number of words or the text box size. The plugin can automatically measure and fill text within a text box, ensuring it fits perfectly. Users can customize their experience by saving language preferences and the number of words to generate for future sessions. With full accessibility support, the plugin also allows users to easily close it after text generation, making it simple and efficient to use.
114629.release_notes: We’ve quickly addressed some minor issues in Version 13 to ensure a smoother experience and optimal functionality. For a detailed overview of the new features introduced in Version 13, please refer to the Version 13 Release Notes.
114629.tagline: Generate placeholder text effortlessly for design mockups. Fast, flexible, and easy to use.

plugins.name: Fitter
plugins.description:
Resize an item to fit its parent’s width, height, or both.


Features

Pretty self-explanitory but for the sake of clarity...

  • Fit: Resizes the width and height of an item to match its parent's
  • Fit Width: Resizes the width of an item to match its parent's
  • Fit Height: Resizes the height of an item to match its parent's


How to use

  1. Select an object or multiple objects that have a parent*
  2. Run the plugin (Tip: use the ⌘/ keyboard shortcut and type "fit" to quickly run the plugin from your keyboard)


*A parent can be a frame, component, group, or boolean.

accepted.name: Danny McClain
accepted.description: Dad, husband, designer, artist, a bit of a developer, and nature enthusiast. He/Him.

11900.description:

  • Fit Height: Resizes the height of an item to match its parent's


How to use

  2. Run the plugin (Tip: use the ⌘/ keyboard shortcut and type "fit" to quickly run the plugin from your keyboard)


*A parent can be a frame, component, group, or boolean.

plugins.name: Circular Text Maker
plugins.description:
Circular Text Maker is the perfect plugin for shaping text into circles and arcs without losing its original styling.


Key Features:

  1. Editable Text: Keeps text fully editable and retains original styles – no need to convert to SVG.
  2. Customizable Shapes: Adjust the degree, radius, and starting angle to create precise arcs or full circles.
  3. Easy to Use: Intuitive controls for quick and seamless text shaping.


Ideal for designing badges, logos, and unique typography, Circular Text Maker adds creative versatility to your projects.
plugins.tagline: Shape Text into Perfect Circles and Arcs – Retain Original Styles with Circular Text Maker

106528.name: Circular Text Maker
106528.description:
Circular Text Maker is the perfect plugin for shaping text into circles and arcs without losing its original styling.


Key Features:

  1. Editable Text: Keeps text fully editable and retains original styles – no need to convert to SVG.
  2. Customizable Shapes: Adjust the degree, radius, and starting angle to create precise arcs or full circles.
  3. Easy to Use: Intuitive controls for quick and seamless text shaping.


Ideal for designing badges, logos, and unique typography, Circular Text Maker adds creative versatility to your projects.
106528.tagline: Shape Text into Perfect Circles and Arcs – Retain Original Styles with Circular Text Maker

plugins.name: PalettePal
plugins.description:
Palette Pal is a plugin that allows you to keep all your favorite colors in one place.

How It Works
===========
Running the plugin will display a window where you can add, remove, and edit colors.

Simply edit the color by either editing the hex value or by opening up the color picker.

You can click on the color box to copy the hex value to your clipboard. Or you can save it to your browser's cache by clicking the lock button.

Additional Features
==============
* Drag to reorder
* Add/Remove colors
* Edit the color of the background to see how well a color works atop another
* Set the difference between the colors

6162.name: PalettePal
6162.description:

You can click on the color box to copy the hex value to your clipboard. Or you can save it to your browser's cache by clicking the lock button.

Additional Features
==============
* Drag to reorder
* Add/Remove colors
* Edit the color of the background to see how well a color works atop another
* Set the difference between the colors

plugins.name: Navigate Multiple Siblings
plugins.description:
Use the plugin to navigate multiple selected siblings. Best use is with component instances.


How to use:

  1. Select multiple (same) instances.
  2. Press Enter key to enter the instance.
  3. Use plugin to move through siblings.


See video explainer.


Create keybindings (macOS only):

  1. Go to Keyboard > Shortcuts tab
  2. Select "App Shortcuts" on the left pane
  3. Add (+) Figma from "Application" dropdown
  4. Upward — under "Menu Title" write Upward and add your custom keybinding in "Keyboard Shortcuts"
  5. Downward — under "Menu Title" write Downward and add your custom keybinding in "Keyboard Shortcuts"
  6. Restart Figma and try it out ;)


—

Read a story — "Community Strikes Back — Figma plugin story" — or, how we created this plugin.

accepted.name: @Мг.Віѕсυіт
accepted.description:

https://www.mrbiscuit.design/

plugins.name: Word Spacing
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to adjust word spacing for text elements.


Basic usage:

  1. Select one or more text elements.
  2. Open the plugin and use the input to modify the word spacing of the selected elements.


You can also set word spacing for specific sections within the same text object.


Important Note:

When using this plugin, be mindful that altering the word spacing directly modifies the text inside the text element(s).

accepted.name: Bas
accepted.description:
Software developer creating tools to make people's lives easier.

For questions or requests you can send me an email at basvanderlinden53@outlook.com

plugins.name: Color Combinator
plugins.description:
Color Combinator (CC) is a Figma plugin for exploring different combinations of colors among elements.

Select elements that you want to see different combinations of and then hit the “Combinate Colors” button in the CC plugin window. Copies of your frame will appear to the right of the original and each will contain a different assignment of colors to elements.

I strongly encourage you to check out the demo video to see it in action: https://vimeo.com/361205568

  CC is a brand new plugin and has a few limitations:
- Supports only Text Nodes 
- Nodes must have only one fill that is a solid paint
- Nodes must be contained in a Frame

- Nodes must be contained in a Frame

plugins.name: Full
plugins.description:
Fit layer to container width / height / both, margin supported.


Usage:

1. If selection's width > height, then full width

2. If selection's height > width, then full height

3. if width = height, then full both (and it will have a new name, to keep it as background)

plugins.name: Dash
plugins.description:
Figma faster with Dash

Quickly find, select and edit layers without taking your hands off your keyboard. Dash consists of 2 parts:


1. Layer search

Find and select layers quickly by keyword and filter just the relevant ones, like only text layers, frames or rectangles. Supports modifiers for expanding the current selection, selecting a parent up the layer tree and even globbing patterns for advanced use cases.


2. Actions

With Actions, you easily change multiple layer properties at once. From changing font sizes, #color, renaming layers and adding component instances, Dash is the fastest way to do so.


Free while in beta

Dash is free to use but for now requires a license still. Get a free license here!


Get started quickly

Want to quickly get comfy with all of Dash's features? Check out the official playground template!


Visit the Dash website for more info.

accepted.name: Andre Jilderda
accepted.description: Freelance front-end developer with a background in design, maker of Figma plugin Dash: http://getdash.app/

plugins.tagline: Quickly find, select and edit layers without taking your hands off your keyboard.

- Use Figma's red lines to measure distances between pixels
- Use Figma's "Select All with Same Fill" to edit pixels in groups
- Select pixels and Flatten ⌘E

Careful: this Plugin becomes slow for large images (larger than 200x200)

plugins.description:

Support file download from iconfont.cn, icomoon.io, fontello.com, iconly.io, etc..

  1. Open plugin

Support File

Usually, all-in-one .svg file made up by <glyph> or <symbol> tags could be supported.

Files download from sites below is tested:

  • https://icomoon.io
  • https://fontello.com

To Contribute

plugins.name: Instagram Multi Post Divider
plugins.description: Instagram Multi Post Divider is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of creating Instagram posts. With just a few inputs, you can generate a main frame of any size, filled with your design, and automatically divide it into perfectly square sub-frames ready for export. The plugin ensures precise alignment and includes a customizable dead zone to avoid cropping important content. Ideal for designers who want to create multi-post Instagram carousels with minimal effort, allowing you to focus on creativity while the plugin handles the technical details.

accepted.name: Etienne Moureton
accepted.description: Frontend developer at unflux. I develop things I like or need. I try to invest myself in its eco system and more widely the OSS ecosystem.

plugins.tagline: Effortlessly split your designs into perfect Instagram posts with auto-export frames in one click.

plugins.name: Split Anything
plugins.description:
Split any type of layer into multiple columns and rows. A useful tool for efficient design work.


Sometimes we refer to it as dividing, splitting, separating, segmenting, or something similar.


🔑 Key Features


  1. Universal Compatibility: Split any type of layer from frames, groups, components, instances, shapes, and more.
  2. Real-Time Preview: Visualize your splits instantly within the plugin interface.
  3. Preserve Original Styling: Maintain the integrity of your design after splitting.
  4. Flexible Customization: Fine-tune with adjustable gutters and margins.


💡 How It Works


  1. Select any layer you want to split.
  2. Open the plugin and set your desired columns and rows. Fine-tune gutters and margins as needed.
  3. See your split in real-time inside plugin before applying.
  4. Click on Split Anything or use shortcut ⌘ + Enter (Mac) / Ctrl + Enter (Windows) to apply. Happy splitting!


🎨 Inspiration


I've been a huge fan of the Split Shape feature when designing in Sketch. After migrating to Figma, I discovered a similar plugin by Gaddafi Rusli, also called Split Shape. I've used it extensively, but sometimes faced issues with visualizing the split process and encountered occasional bugs. This inspired me to recreate the plugin while learning to code, aiming to add real-time preview functionality and ensure compatibility with various layer types.


👍 Like this? Tip me at coff.ee/afnizarnur
plugins.tagline: Split any type of layer into multiple column and rows.

plugins.name: DesignSystemColours
plugins.description:
A tool to speed up the process of creating the colour palette of a design system.


With this tool, colour styles will automatically be added, using the standard BEM naming convention, making access and usage during design as easy as possible.


How to use:


  1. Find a colour you want to use in your design.
  2. Convert the colour to HEX (or RGB) format and make a note of the value(s).
  3. Input these values to the plugin, and the rest will be done for you!


If you have any suggestions for how this plugin could be improved, please let me know :)


Comment how you find the plugin, and how much it improves your design system process - I would be really interested to know if you find it useful.

plugins.name: Name Lint
plugins.description:
Name Lint

An easy way to find and rename all default-named elements in the current page.

Default-named elements include (where N is a number):

  • Frame N
  • Group N
  • Rectangle N
  • Ellipse N
  • ...

Why?

This plugin is particularly useful to prepare designs for developer-handoff, where developers usually name their variables and classes using the designers names.

Having the same element names in both Figma and your codebase makes the communication between designers and developer easier, but also makes it easier to backtrace elements from code to design and iterate faster.

More info

Open source: https://github.com/richardguerre/figma-name-lint

Inspired by the Design Lint Figma Plugin by destefanis.

accepted.name: Richard Guerre
accepted.description: Currently in stealth mode | Check out my "One Figma Shortcut a Day" browser extension and "Name Lint" Figma plugin

Why?

Having the same element names in both Figma and your codebase makes the communication between designers and developer easier, but also makes it easier to backtrace elements from code to design and iterate faster.

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced designer, Figma Learn provides a structured learning experience, covering everything from the basics to advanced techniques. Join a vibrant community, tackle real-world design projects, and unlock your design potential with Figma Learn
plugins.tagline: Tagline: Elevate your design skills

57935.name: Figma Learn
57935.description: Figma Learn is a user-friendly tool that offers comprehensive tutorials and interactive challenges to help you master the Figma design tool. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced designer, Figma Learn provides a structured learning experience, covering everything from the basics to advanced techniques. Join a vibrant community, tackle real-world design projects, and unlock your design potential with Figma Learn

plugins.name: Apply Local Styles
plugins.description:
Reassign an external style to a local style of the same name in a matter of seconds.


The plugin doesn't have an interface.


How does it work:

  1. Select some layers you want to update. When nothing is selected, all layers on the page are updated.
  2. Launch the plugin. The plugin will identify styles with matching names associated with local styles, and apply them all at once based on your selection.
  3. A layer whose style has not been updated will be highlighted.


--

The plugin may slow down if there are too many layers on the page. If this is the case, try selecting layers instead.

accepted.name: andrei alikimovich
accepted.description: senior product designer at remitly.com

plugins.tagline: reassign styles, external → local

  2. Launch the plugin. The plugin will identify styles with matching names associated with local styles, and apply them all at once based on your selection.
  3. A layer whose style has not been updated will be highlighted.


--

The plugin may slow down if there are too many layers on the page. If this is the case, try selecting layers instead.

plugins.name: Butler
plugins.description:
Butler helps you with three things:


- It let’s you search for local components to insert your current

position


- You can apply any local style to your current selection


- Go to any node in your document


Open the plugin, press TAB to switch commands or search for your desired component or style.


Caveats:


Users working with large documents may experience long loading times, this is due to how you’re allowed to fetch assets from the API.


Local assets only, meaning that unfortunately styles and components from your libraries won’t be collected. Also due to what is allowed to collect or not from the API, (and probably righteously so concerning security risks).


I’ve found a kind of similair plugin called Figma Walker made by Kazushi Kawamura,

you can find his plugins here: https://www.figma.com/@kawamurakazushi


Repository:

https://github.com/MikaelWeidenhielm/butler-figma-plugin

accepted.name: Mikael Weidenhielm
accepted.description: Computer boy drawing & coding rectangles.

plugins.name: AxiDraw
plugins.description:
Easily control an AxiDraw drawing machine from Figma. Prepare your vector art and send it to the plotter in one click.


Note: A prompt will invite you to install the required AxiDraw driver on first launch.


This plugin is based on saxi by Jeremy Rose @nornagon.


Thanks to Evil Mad Scientist Laboratories (creators of the AxiDraw) for making pen plotting accessible to almost everyone!


Find out more about AxiDraw: https://axidraw.com/

accepted.name: Stef Tervelde
accepted.description: Developer and Designer

plugins.tagline: Easily control an AxiDraw drawing machine from Figma.

plugins.name: Gerte note plugin
plugins.description:
The plugin adds notes with an arrow. But if you want the note to work properly, you need to change the frame

width and height "hug". Please be kind, this is my first plugin. And I promise I'll fix it. When I find a way to fix it. ;)

plugins.name: My Mock Data
plugins.description:
this plugin allows you to import Support data source and quickly populate text and images.

Features:
- local data format support: Json, Yaml, Csv
- online data support: api request ... (coming soon)

Usage:
1. click "+" to create a new dataset.
2. enter dataset, and select a data path to establish a connection.
3. click the sync button in "Connect" to begin.

Notes:
- you need to manually select which arrays to loop through after selecting the path
